page.title: 07WOODS AND MOORLAND :ST.WENN
page.content: Our locality has a high percentage of woodland.Much of this is ancient and is old{oak}trees.There is heavy tree cover in the valleys and common species are{hazel,sycamore and {holly.Thorn}is also common. Some area of{beech}are been planted and the more prosperous farms often have species that have been introduced.The deciduous trees are the most popular. The areas of rough grazing and moorland are covered by{grasses,ferns and{bracken.}This supplies a good habitat for wildlife and especially birds of prey. { Owl pellets}are common finds.We have made a study of them and have found the bones and fur of small rodents like{mice,shrews,voles}and even{small {rabbits.}Much of our spare time is spent exploring our woods and moors.
